website_summaries.verdict: Easy to use, and easy to keep clean. Quick rocking and tilting action eliminates the need for scooping. Very affordable price point.
pros: Simple tilting maneuver separates clean and dirty litter
Deep tray holds a lot of litter
cons: Litter can leak out or stick to grate
Tabs are not secure, creating a mess when they fail

customer_reviews.title: I remember reading a few bad reviews on this item and I bought it anyway
customer_reviews.text: I remember reading a few bad reviews on this item and I bought it anyway. Was it worth it? Do you like cleaning up cat sh*t? :) I can't tell you how happy I am, being the only one in the house having to do this horrible chore. It makes cleaning up (enjoyable isn't the word) suck less. Hasn't broken down (If you are abusive to this I am sure it will break), we use fresh step (even the light version) and works like a dream. If this one ends up breaking I would buy again and again, be sure to clean the litter box frequently as it is easier when there is less stuff in there.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: 5 year update
customer_reviews.text: I really like this litter box, and it was completely trouble-free for the first 3 years. The design is great but beware you need to get down on your knees to roll it over, and the rolling action will eventually start to weaken the inner grate. By reinforcing it I've managed to keep it working for the past 5 years, but the more you reinforce the box, the harder it becomes to take it apart to clean it. I think it's a good value for the money and will buy a new one when this one "craps out".
customer_reviews.author: Gary M

customer_reviews.title: Dump litter easily...
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second box, and like them pretty well. They make cleaning out the litter a lot easier. One downside: when you turn it over to empty, a small amount of litter does drop out the edges. A quick swipe with a dust pan and brush cleans it up. Another point, which in general should not be a concern, you cannot purchase parts for it. So if something breaks or wears out you have to purchase a new one. Hence the reason I purchased the second once.
customer_reviews.author: 56_Kruiser

customer_reviews.title: Best invention ever made
customer_reviews.text: I hate cat litter, and said I'd never have another indoor cat, but we moved to the country and I don't want her to be coyote food so inside she lives. This made my life a thousand times easier, and it's pretty inexpensive. One annoying thing is the filter keeps unclipping from it's position and the litter goes right under it unless I stick my hand in the litter and push it back into place - I'm sure this is just because it's cheap plastic. It's annoying, but I could easily clean it out and glue the filter into place, but I'm lazy (hence the self cleaning litter box) so I just make my boyfriend clean it for now ;)
customer_reviews.author: Kendall

customer_reviews.title: The concept was good. Sadly lacking in the actual design
customer_reviews.text: The concept was good. Sadly lacking in the actual design. I found the plastic screen inside does not stay in place. Also, when "rolling" the litter box to the right, the hing/clasp in front comes apart and leaked kitty litter sand all over. If they were to redesign with better materials and more clasps, it would be a great cat litter box. Oh, when rolling the litter box and then rolling back, this has to be done several times to catch the majority of the big clumps. I then had to scoop the little stuff out with a regular litter sifting scooper.
customer_reviews.author: J. Graft

customer_reviews.title: Complete cleaning a pain in the...
customer_reviews.text: It’s the EASIEST to “scoop" (actually roll) litter pan ever! Love it! Can do it in a blink all day long. Tho it IS kind of a small area for the cat to work in Unfortunately I’ve quit using it because the grate eventually gets clogged up with urine-sticky litter. The pan must be taken apart, the main pieces are large and cumbersome for a standard wash tub, so must be washed outside with a hose. Keep being creative people. We’ll build the perfect, affordable litter pan some day.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia P.

customer_reviews.title: ... omegapaw in the middle with 3 stars because I love the innovation and concept of how this box works ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm meeting omegapaw in the middle with 3 stars because I love the innovation and concept of how this box works but I don't love the huge mess it leaves when the item (plastic grate) breaks on you. I just went through a kitty litter nightmare because my box defaulted conveniently just after a year of purchase. That being said, I just ordered another one and will try to reinforce the grate myself upon assembly because that's how much I like the concept of easy scoop.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean. Duct tape solves the leaking problem
customer_reviews.text: So nice! I have 2 of these in my 2-cat home. They are so easy to clean! You just roll it over and empty the bin. It’s that easy! I find myself cleaning it 1-2 times per week. The only problem I have with the design is that when I roll them over, the crystals tend to leak out where the top hooks onto the bottom. Coordinate duct tape solves this problem and I am much happier than before. It’s the only flaw in the design (except for tracking litter out of the box. It’s the reason I gave it a 4-Star review although with the duct tape it’s the only choice for my house!
customer_reviews.author: POPS N MIMI

customer_reviews.title: It is awesome. Beware
customer_reviews.text: at first I couldn't figure this box out. It just seem odd having to roll it all the way to one side. Then I realize why. It is awesome. Beware, do not put too much litter in it or it will not work as it is suppose to. I have 3 cats and I think I may have to get a second one. I have to roll this every day, cats can be so finicky, and one keeps peeing right at the entrance if I don't clean it daily. But it beats having to use the scooper to scoop poo all the time. It was worth the $40..
customer_reviews.author: kayeleonie

customer_reviews.title: Works, but has many cons.
customer_reviews.text: I am very torn about this litter box. On the one hand, its easy and quick to empty, on the other, it makes a total mess every single time, and cat pee/wet litter gets stuck to the inside very easily. And I mean, really stuck. Like, hardest pressure on the garden hose to get it off stuck... Everytime I roll the box, it somehow drops a ton of litter outside the box, making more of a mess for me to clean. Its very annoying. And to be honest, the box is kind of small for a normal sized cat. However, it gets the job done, so Im giving it 3 stars. Its good, but it comes with setbacks.
customer_reviews.author: PwincessMewMew

customer_reviews.title: What a great idea
customer_reviews.text: What a neat idea. Went to together easy and tight. Not sure why others have issues with the cleaning method. If you look inside you can see where the litter goes so turn it slowly till all the litter goes into its space. Then continue rolling till its upside down. Hit the bottom with your hands a couple of times then slowly roll it back down. Roll a little farther until all the litter comes back out of its compartment. Pull out the tray and dispose of the waste. Easy Peasy. Remember not to overfill the box with litter or some of that litter will end up in the waste compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Jwilson5

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Cat Box!
customer_reviews.text: For those of you that don't want to shell out nearly $500 for the amazing Litter Robot, get this! Having this litterbox is the only way I can get my kids to clean a litterbox without gagging. I dare say, it's even fun! Yes, you'll need to scrape the bottom of the box periodically with a pooper scooper but so what? Also, make sure you thump it upside down in multiple areas. It's true the tabs are weak, but that's not a deal breaker. Be sure to couple this with the litter genie and you're good to go. We've had ours about a year and it's still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: burgandy01

customer_reviews.title: Buy it. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: You guys... it's impossible to truly explain how revolutionary this litterbox is. It will truly change your life. I didn't believe the hype at first and wasn't excited over spending $30+ on a place for my cats to do their business, but OHMYGOODNESS I am so glad I bought this! I have bought one at the store and one on Amazon - same brand, same size. The quality of the one on Amazon is better AND it was $20 cheaper, so just bite the bullet, buy it, and bid your nasty ol' pooper scooper goodbye!
customer_reviews.author: borderrat906

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I have a bad back and bought this to avoid all of the bending involved in cleaning the litter box. It worked fine the first few times, then sprung a leak. After that, every time I flipped it, some of the litter leaked out onto the floor. Eventually the two halves wouldn't even stay together. I haven't used the flipping feature in a year. Replacing it. Too bad because it's a good idea in theory.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Nan

customer_reviews.title: Am enjoying clean litter!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, the efficacy of this piece of equipment is predicated entirely on your ability to beat the dog to the unit after cat does his/her post-dump burn-out. If you do, it's sooo much easier to clean. We still have our pooper scooper to help those recalcitrant bits over the screen into the drawer. I'm pleased. Will be keeping a bag of unopened litter on top to keep the dog from pushing it around to where she can get her nose in it. That's the second way to keep this unit clean. Works if you can keep the dog out of your face after he/she has feasted.
customer_reviews.author: Curious

customer_reviews.title: NEVER SCOOP LITTER AGAIN!
customer_reviews.text: This is literally the best litter box ever. Forget scooping! I didn’t want to buy one of the expensive electronic ones, so settled on this because I hated scooping the nasty litter. It’s great! I haven’t scooped litter in 2 years since buying these! You sometimes have to bang on the bottom while rolling it to get clumps off, but it totally beats scooping!
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: This thing is absolutely awesome.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is absolutely awesome. It does not require special bags or a plug. You can "empty" this in less than 10 seconds and it works great. it does not leak any litter during emptying - no idea why some people have that issue. You will need about 5 linear feet to roll it over to fill the trough and back. I have 4 cats - used to have 2 litter boxes with fences. it took 10 minutes to clean and there was litter everywhere. Now I can roll it over twice a day and takes all of 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Ken I. Mataya

customer_reviews.title: It is a brilliant idea but just not well made
customer_reviews.text: Ugh! You have to be REALLY good at getting just the right amount of litter or it will pour out of the sides when tipped. And I use A&H clumping litter (the best of all reviewed) and the pee clumps on the bottom do not come off with a bang on the bottom because you came put enough litter in there to have a decent bottom layer. And, where the grates meet the sides of the little box, little pieces of poo and pee get trapped. Ugh. It is a brilliant idea but just not well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Kirkbride

customer_reviews.title: ... down clips & the kung fu grip for the waste drawer. My only ding is if the grate ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the newer design with the push down clips & the kung fu grip for the waste drawer. My only ding is if the grate starts to tear at the corners again. I do intend on using a hair dryer to heat up the seam BEFORE bending. I also suggest getting a can of clear to spray the bottom & lower sides, grate, and waste drawer. Makes it far easier to clean. Natures Miracle Litter Powder works great as well. My ding is the $19.99 shipping to get a replacement grate. $26 for everything vs $20 for just the grate, real tough decision Omega Paw.
customer_reviews.author: btc909

customer_reviews.title: Good litter box for the non-lazy
customer_reviews.text: This litter box has its pros and cons: Pros: Big enough for my two cats to use, keeps urine from going out of the box as well as litter (some). Its a nice design to roll it and collect the clumps in the side compartment and throw away. Cons: If you don't continually clean it often, there will be too much in the side compartments, making a mess and forcing you to just open the box and clean it manually, defeating the purpose of the "self cleaning" design. Unfortunately my laziness contributes to this design. Otherwise this litter box is nice and conveniently keeps you from actual scooping.
customer_reviews.author: Mom & Vet Tech

customer_reviews.title: Great, but doesn't work for my cat
customer_reviews.text: Great concept. Roll the litterbox, to filter out the good stuff and keep the bits separated - and then just toss the bits away! I gave it four stars, however, because it's not ventilated - and my cat, in her old age, has developed some respiratory issues. So doesn't work for her so much. It's not a bad product, and I can see why ventilation is a no go - you stick a vent on the top and everything's gonna spill all over when you go to clean the box. Sticking with a classic Booda dome for now.
customer_reviews.author: D. Carr

customer_reviews.title: great in theory, poor in actuality
customer_reviews.text: This litter box system is great in theory, and at first it worked for me. But very quickly, the filter-wall stopped staying in place when I turned the box upside down, and when I turned it right-side up again, clean and dirty portions of litter remained hopelessly intermixed. Additionally, from the start, pieces of litter and even small feces fell out of the front opening when I turned the box upside down.Given all the positive reviews, I wonder whether the box I got shipped was defective in at least two ways.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L. Hermer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: So far its working fairly well. The flap that sifts the litter sometimes flips out which is annoying, that is my only gripe at the moment. If it can hold up over the next year, paired with a liter champ/genie garbage, then I will be forever satisfied. The pull out tray fits perfect into my liter champ, never have to scoop poo or pee in my life again hopefully or smell it as it's so easy. I am a bodybuilder-ish type of guy, so bending over and flipping this thing over is no big deal, but if your a small person who does not exercise this thing may get slightly heavy with normal clay litter, but there are lighter alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Kokero

customer_reviews.title: a great product made better
customer_reviews.text: I have had the smaller size of this product for 10 years. I decided to get a new one and opted for the larger size. I was happy to see that the only issue I ever had with the old one, which was the clips attaching the top and bottom half together sliding and unlatching themselves, had been fixed with a new clamping design. also, the slightly larger size made a difference as well. I no long get stared at as my cat sticks her head out of the opening while attending to her business...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very fast and much better than scooping
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It is easy to clean up after my two cats, and it rolls easily. It is not an automatic cleaner, and works best with clumping litter. There are no other costs. No special trays or bags! I clean it once a day. If you wait longer it may cause large clumps to form, which may stick to the bottom. I have only great things to say about this unique design. I recommend it to all of my friends. Note: There are actually two sizes. Make sure that you buy the large one.
customer_reviews.author: SuzieQ

customer_reviews.title: Cool concept!
customer_reviews.text: Ok I wouldn't really call this litter box self cleaning bc you still have to empty it! But it makes it easier for sure. You put the litter inside then when it needs to be scooped you turn it over on its lid and the poop and clumps fall into a removable tray. Pull the tray out and dispose the waste. The clean litter sifts into the right side of the box then back out when you put it upright again. Pretty cool idea. Yes the latches are a bit flimsy and somehow my cat pushes the tray out a bit (I think he's playing) but overall this is a great litter box. I would recommend it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: krista

customer_reviews.title: Did not Disappoint
customer_reviews.text: It took me a minute to figure out how to use it properly, but afterwards it was a time saver. I love not having to scoop and sift, all you do is turn it to the right and basically flip upside down so that the debris is separated from the clean litter into the pull out tray. Easy Peasy! I had gotten used to having a covered litter box so I worried about the possible smell. So far this hasn't been much of an issue, mainly because I got a pet odor absorbing disk from Walmart. My cats had no issues adjusting to its use. I'm considering replacing one of my other hooded litter boxes with a second of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more scooping
customer_reviews.text: Works great. You have to roll slowly to the right side give it a couple wacks on the bottom and sides to loosen any stuck stuff and listen for the thumps. Slowly roll it back to the left so the dirty litter falls into the tray. Pull out tray and dump. Return tray and slowly continue rolling back to the left side to get all the litter back. Don't roll either way to fast as the grate tray that filters the clean litter may come loose from the brackets that hold it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend that if you switch to this using box that ...
customer_reviews.text: The litter box works how it's described, and fairly well. I would recommend that if you switch to this using box that (i) you use the self-scooping feature frequently - as in every few days, and (2) use super clumping litter. Otherwise, it gets hard to roll everything and to use the cleaning tray as intended. I don't include this to be gross, but on a practical note: scooping frequently will also help some of the "softer" pieces pick up more litter and dry out, and not stick to the plastic filter grate as badly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clever
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Maybe the flap is poorly designed, maybe you have to buy a new one once a year. SO WHAT? $25/year to never have to scoop again? $25/year to never have to ask cat-sitting friends to scoop again? It's comical to me that other reviews rate this as two stars for this flaw, and for the clips. It's just not that big of a deal. Design could be improved, sure. But it does what it's supposed to, for $25. Not $300 like those crazy electric ones that work TERRIBLY anyway. EASY DECISION. Hell I'd buy one a month.
customer_reviews.author: ctk909

customer_reviews.title: Durable, but still a glitch or two.
customer_reviews.text: For the inexpensive price, I don't feel this box is any less flimsy than any other kitty litter box out there. I think the only thing that was a bit of a problem for me was the piece inside, that separates the litter, staying in place properly. It kept moving out of place and getting pieces of feces stuck behind it. I think that after a few glitches are worked out with this design, it has good promise; I went back to the old school litter box for now.
customer_reviews.author: Miss T.

customer_reviews.title: Omega Pet People-cleaning litter box.....
customer_reviews.text: My cat Flower loved her Omega Pet People-cleaning litter box. The first one I had lasted for over 4 years until the sifter was ripping at the crease from being removed for a total cleaning. So when Rocky came along I purchased another Omega, but this time I reinforced the crease with Duct tape and 4 years later it's still going strong. My 3rd Omega, which is in storage, came from Amazon Warehouse, it has a surface blemish and not in its original packaging. It was all most 1/2 price. Just waiting for the one Rockys using to wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Nonny07

customer_reviews.title: I've recommended this cat box to like everyone I know
customer_reviews.text: THIS MAKES LIFE EASIER! I've recommended this cat box to like everyone I know. My cat is super fat and usually hates inclosed cat boxes but since this is the easiest one to clean, it gets cleaned out more often than his other boxes, he has come to favor this cat box. It's super easy to filter the liter. I don't feel super gross after having sifted cat litter like normal. It obviously still needs to be overhaul cleaned out but it's not anymore difficult than any other enclosed cat box. I definitely recommend this cat box and will probably slowly replace the other cat boxes in my house with this style. I super recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Although the concept is generally good, for me it is more of a hassle ...
customer_reviews.text: Although the concept is generally good, for me it is more of a hassle to use this then simply scooping the litter waste. You need about 4-5 feet of open space to roll this box effectively and as intended. I decided that it was easier to scoop then to go through the hassle of rolling this large unit. Perhaps if someone has many cats, they may find it easier then scooping the old fashioned way. I purchased the litter genie plus on another site as well, and I absolutely love it! 5 stars for that for sure. It makes scooping the old fashioned way so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN J  LIGHTFOOT

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design, and Cheap Construction
customer_reviews.text: thought this would save time, be more efficient, and beat the regular cat box cleaning, WRONG! Problem is #1. the scoop that the poop and lumps fall into is way too small and not deep enough, causing the larger clumps preventing the scoop tray to be removed, and or a mess on the floor. Being all plastic, the top and bottom sections do not FIT together tightly, and the cheap plastic latches don't close easy meaning sooner or later they will break defeating their purpose and the purpose of rolling the box to the right or left without litter leaking out from box which is a big mess, so don't recommend buying this item
customer_reviews.author: Garald Williams

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it and so do I
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure my male would fit or even try it. He loves it. It's easy to clean but the slides to take the top off to add new litter sometime stick. Still I really like this product. Fast forward and I'm downgrading my rating. The plastic slides are tough to slide, sometimes the top "pops" off creating a mess. Since it's a lot of work to take the top off and on to refill the litter, I now refill by pouring clean litter into a smaller container and then into the litter box. There's nothing self-cleaning about it.
customer_reviews.author: irisheyes

customer_reviews.title: I WISH i COULD GIVE THIS PRODUCT A NEGATIVE FIVE! DO NOT BUY!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I WISH i COULD GIVE THIS PRODUCT A NEGATIVE FIVE! The lid doesn't fit well and is hard to get snapped into place, When the cats pee on the sides, the clumps just stick there, the sides aren't slick enough for the the clumps to fall off. You end up opening it up and handling the waste anyway. The drawer has no track and doesn't work well. My wife wants to kill me for getting this. Of course the box is gone and it's dirty now so there is $thirty something DOLLARS out the window, I feel like I been robbed! Buyer beware, do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: A1 Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Litter Box Problems
customer_reviews.text: After a month of heavy use by two cats the inner plastic screen broke and would not separate the poops from the good clay litter.... The outer clamps were also hard to hinge and unhinge..The front one broke. This item was a wast of money ...returned to a large plastic storage box with a hole cut in the front and using a plastic rake sold in the pet section now does the job quite nicely and at a lesser cost...
customer_reviews.author: Jitney

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but only for some cats.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but doesn't last that long. The clips are weak and once they break, litter will pour out of the seams. Also, if your cat pees against the edge, forget it with this box, as the litter will congeal around the grated screen and possible even break because of it. This would be best for small cats who have not yet been hit with aging kidneys.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy

customer_reviews.title: Concept is great, just needs a few adjustments to the design.
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept, the issue is that the clips that hold it together don't line up perfectly, plus the plastic clips aren't sturdy enough. If they improve on the clips then it would be worth having. The other problem is the shelf where the waste receptacle sits, slowly at the bend starts tearing. Other than those two issues, I did love it until the tear made it so it was unable to be used. Fix those two problems and I would buy one again.
customer_reviews.author: Bryon

customer_reviews.title: Speedy
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, there is nothing to dislike about this product. It is the perfect size for my cat. It is really easy to clean. It was really easy to assemble. There honestly isn't anything bad to say about this. Even the price was amazing. I've recommended this to one of my feline cat groups on Facebook. Yes, I am that crazy cat lady. I only have one though and she's the crazy one.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryll

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It's a little more awkward than the demo shows, but it does work well. It can be a bit difficult to re-fill the litter tho. What I ended up doing was pouring fresh litter into the pull out tray and dumping it into box that way instead of trying to take off the whole lid. My clasps were a bit difficult to get hooked so I didn't want to have to do that every time the litter needed re-filling. I have this litter box on a card table (no stooping to scoop!) and it's a big box but it does work on the table.
customer_reviews.author: Kiana M. Wilder

customer_reviews.title: This is the one.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat went right in. No learning curve for wife and self. Roll it, dump it. Major problem is no feline language instructions. Cat uses for fecal elimination and believes Gorilla grip mat in front of Box is for urine. Thankfully the mat hold back the tide and rinses out. Mine came with manual touting new improved latches, and box featuring old slider latches. Still works as advertised. Now then, flushable kitty liter, might just make this working proposition. Any cat whisperers know how to say pee INSIDE the box ?
customer_reviews.author: happy

customer_reviews.title: Not very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: Im not real happy with this litter box. Elite fits tight which enables you to Tilt The Box once a day or twice a day when need it. But it also makes it difficult for you to check the box to make sure that it did empty clean. I'm using tidy cat litter and this sometimes sticks to the Box, I'm going to have to try a different litter to see what will work best with this box. Also drawer does not fit very tight.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: It started out great, but after a while cat litter would come out around the drawer when you tipped it. A lot of clean litter would end up in the drawer. Then the stupid sifter thing decided it did not want to stay in place. I ended up just going with a regular cat box. This became too much work.
customer_reviews.author: Maggi Sanhueza

customer_reviews.title: Good Design. Bad Construction
customer_reviews.text: This is a large litter box so make sure you have room not only for it to fit but also to roll it 180 degrees to clean it. I really liked the design but the plastic it was made from and it’s general construction made it a nightmare to use. It basically snaps together and therein lies the problem. It is difficult to get everything aligned and to keep it aligned so that when you rotated it for cleaning, it did not fall apart. I tried to make it work for a month then threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Mezzanotte

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased it
customer_reviews.text: We have had this litter box in large for longer than 6 months and it continues to work well for us and our 20lb fluffy cat. I always check my seals before rolling and I make sure I do not overfill the litter and I empty the box every day. I have followed the suggestions of other reviewers and videos to smack the bottom of the box once it is rolled over then continue to roll it as instructed then back over and tilt the opposite direction so un-clumped litter shifts back evenly. I am glad we purchased this as it makes cleaning the box quick and doesn't have any refills/trays/bags or mechanisms to purchase(other than clumping cat litter).
customer_reviews.author: Heather W

customer_reviews.title: A Tupperware Box of the Right Size is Better
customer_reviews.text: There is no quick fix to having scoop cat feces. This box was harder to clean than a big storage Tupperware box, which is the best thing for a litter box. The only notable thing about this contraption is that our two baby kitties hid from us in the box - not inside the litter, but in the tray that is supposed to catch the droppings when you roll it (and, then, you're supposed to pull the tray out and dump it). We had a frantic 5 hours thinking the babies had escaped, and then something told me to check the litter box - they were curled up in the tray together. Cute - but gross.
customer_reviews.author: Millie

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, however I found two issues
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, however I found two issues. 1. There are no instructions as to how much litter to put into the box. If I put too little, things get, well, sticky to the bottom and/or sides, and 2. the latches to hold the top to the bottom half of the box are very difficult to work with, as though they do not properly align, and they sometimes leave gaps so when the box is rolled to deposit pet waste into the drawer, sand leaks out onto the floor. More clean up! I will say, when it works, it's a charm. I have 3 cats, so maybe this would be better suited to a 1 cat household.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: If you have a cat, YOU MUST have one of these
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Omega Paw self-cleaning litter boxes we have purchased. The first one lasted about 2 years before a crack in lower front. They have redesigned the product and it is much improved. I love the action on this litter box. I have owned cats for 40 years and this is the best litter box I have ever used. NEVER have to get into the box, except to do a full clean out and refreshen about once ever 3-4 months. Using clump litter the action on this box makes cleaning the litter box much less of a chore..
customer_reviews.author: Rock Doc

customer_reviews.title: Cat parents new friend
customer_reviews.text: I really like the ease of this product. Assemble, fill, then tilt for easy clean up. Unfortanately we've hit some snags along the way. First, I wish there was a liner to be used with this product. Second, sometimes our cats pee clods are too large to come through the poop removal drawer. It takes a few tries to get through the hole then there's pee clods on the top. Sometimes the poop or pee sticks to the bottom of the container and you have to loosen it with a scooper anyways. Our cats love it and it's been simple enough. Thanks for making it a little easier for us cat parents
customer_reviews.author: Jordan E

customer_reviews.title: Just Uh...
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the sturdiest litter box and I only clean my boxes every 3-4 weeks, so I really don't filter, I tend to dump everything and start fresh. You really do need to make sure everything is latched properly because it will leak when you tip it and the drawer has a tendency to slide out. I have one I can share with you because I'm replacing it with a top open one.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Harnish

customer_reviews.title: So much better than a regular box!
customer_reviews.text: This makes cleaning the box so much easier! You do have to tilt the box father than what it says but, to be able to tilt the box a few times back and forth and then just pull out a drawer is great! There is less dust because you are sifting and the lid stays on. You are really getting hands on so, it's cleaner as well!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great concept - Not realistic - Poor execution
customer_reviews.text: Bottom half came misshapen and would not properly attach to the top. The screen in the middle doesn't attach to the bottom half. Tried my best to connect it, however the latches just pop off. I felt like I was trying to put a queen size fitted sheet on a king size bed! Just not enough plastic to connect. Thought maybe that's just how it was set up - and Litter fell out everywhere on the floor, which by that point was hilarious. The concept of this box is great - but relying on several pieces of plastic to be perfectly aligned and shaped is unrealistic. Returned the product - with GREAT Amazon customer service!
customer_reviews.author: chickballer20

customer_reviews.title: Great litter box
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because it sounded too good to be true. It really is easy to clean. I am very pleased with this litter box. It was awkward the first time I put it together, the clasps didn't catch very well. Once I figured it out then it wasn't a big deal. Besides figuring out how to put it together, this is the best litter box I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nifty.lol my cats love it and it's easy to clean. I bought 2 of them. You literal just roll it over slowly to let the screen filter the clumps. You do have to smack the bottom to dislodge any clumps if they pee in one corner. Then you roll back flat pull out the tray,dispose of used litter. Then roll box to the left and the unused litter returns to they potty area.
customer_reviews.author: bobbie oldham

customer_reviews.title: The entire inside of the lid will be covered in pee and poop!
customer_reviews.text: No matter how quickly you try to clean up the mess in the box, the litter will inevitably get stuck all over the entire inside of this box. If you try to turn it after a fresh poop, the poop spears all over the lid. If you do it when the pee gets pretty soaked, the pee crusted litter will stick to the lid. There is ALWAYS something disgusting on the lid of this box. Which will eventually get on your cat, then on your hand. It's a terrible design.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Clever idea.
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly as advertised. Makes cleaning up much easier. You still will have to take it out occasionally and hose it off, but daily removal of soiled litter is easy. It's a very clever idea. Some have mentioned that the latches are cheap and break. I've only had mine about a month, but I think if you treat them with some care the latches will last. The plastic is cheap and if the lid and base don't line up, it is hard to make the latches work. If they are forced they will break. You just have to be patient and line up the lid and base and the latches work fine. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Flabbadydoo

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but..
customer_reviews.text: I liked the concept and after watching some youtube videos decided to purchase one. I keep it in a small bath with sink and stool in it so there isn't much room to maneuver. To clean it, I pull it into an adjacent bedroom and go through the procedure. Invariably some of the kitty litter leaks out onto the carpet as I do this. Many times the clumps formed by urine are bigger than the drawer that catches the solids and jambs it shut making opening a very messy affair. These clumps also fairly frequently stick firmly to the inside walls of the litter box, requiring disassembly and scraping off the sides.
customer_reviews.author: dp

customer_reviews.title: Great litter box, best so far! great concept!
customer_reviews.text: Update: 3 of the clasp, that hold the lid down, broke. Then the inside divider broke. We have 5 cats (4 kittens and their mom). The construction is pretty solid, I am impressed with the quality of the plastic used. | Emptying the box is pretty easy, as so far we've used the drawer to empty the solids and then whats left (usually from the kittens) we use a scooper. Once the kittens start making bigger poops we will use the drawer to scoop out only. I LOVE the idea of no more plastic liners!
customer_reviews.author: Cher Bear

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but doesn't work all that great
customer_reviews.text: Good idea, but doesn't work all that great. My cat peed in it and it came right out through the seam of the box, little gets stuck in the vents and design isn't very sturdy feeling . The drawer that pulls out doesn't catch everything, works but wish I would've bought something else that works better. Will probably replace this sooner than later. Kinda small for the size, since half of the box is for the waste litter when you're emptying it. I've had a Booda cat littler before, they are the circular ones and will go back to that.
customer_reviews.author: Snowpurls

customer_reviews.title: LOVED THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I hate the smell of cat liter and though that has a lot to do with the type of liter you buy and how often you change it, this took the job of cleaning the litter to a bearable place! I loved being able to just roll it and then pull out the drawer to a waste container. Super easy and very smart design. The inside wall for separating, did sometimes pull away and I'd have to keep clicking it back in place, but overall, this is the best cat litter box I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Mack

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, but needs improving
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, but needs more design work. For starters, pet owners on the small side or with limited strength/mobility may have a very difficult time cleaning the litter box, since it does involve tipping the full box back and forth. Also, because the materials used are not exactly rigid, after the first couple of times cleaning the litter box as recommended, granules of litter get trapped between the edges of the top and bottom layers, making a gap through which litter leaks on subsequent cleaning attempts. It would be more expensive, but the edges need to be reinforced to prevent this from happening. The cats themselves seem to like the box well enough.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Would have been great if it lasted!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product until 1 week ago. I even purchased one for my neighbor. When it works, it works great! However, I found some shortcomings very early. 1. The slide clasps are plastic and are not very secure. 2. The poop drawer occasionally slides out while rolling the pan (just a little bit but enough to dump litter). The box is now about 2 months and the plastic screen has cracked around the edges. Now, litter enters the poop drawer and we still have poop in the box. Obviously the filter screen is not working correctly. I cannot tell you how disappointed I am. I will try to return it. We'll see what happens.......
customer_reviews.author: twinmom45

customer_reviews.title: Better Now!
customer_reviews.text: Liked it enough to order a second and found out I didn't have the sifter-screen sitting in between the marks located on inside bottom of box. I think it will work much better now! Be sure to have top and bottom lined up so you can snap tightly closed using the four snap hindges. Also, when ready to dispose of cat waste, be sure to completely tilt or rock to the right so clumps go into the scoop. Then back to the left to even out litter on bottom. Waste should be in scoop drawer for you to pull out and empty of waste.
customer_reviews.author: Katmom43

customer_reviews.title: Amazing at first! Not as effective in the long term
customer_reviews.text: This works great at first! The design is really clever, and the quick roll beats scooping. My complaint is that after having the product for a long time, the plastic insert that filters the litter and catches the poop cracks and then becomes unable to stay in place when rolling. Once that happens both good litter and clumped litter end up in the waste receptacle. I loved the product for the first year, but now that I've had it for longer and my insert has cracked it doesn't work and I'm back to scooping. I will contact the company to see if they can provide a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: ajsteph

customer_reviews.title: It's a pass for me.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the idea of this, but it just doesn't function as intended & it stunk. I bought decent quality litter & cleaned it every day but it was as if the plastic trapped the urine smell in the nooks & crannies of the removal tray. When rolling to clean it, it'd often leak litter. My cat took to it well & he was a digger & a kicker so the walls were great... But yeah, the way it would waft cat stink even after being cleaned made this a hard no for me.
customer_reviews.author: Largely Useless

customer_reviews.title: Happy, Sturdy Litter Box
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy litter box. I have two cats, and it makes cleaning the litter a much faster chore than it used to be, as long as you have a litter that works well with it. I use TidyCats clumping litter, and it seems to work just fine. My mom took care of my cats for me while I was studying abroad, and she had more issues with cleaning it. She said it was too difficult, so she just unlatched the top and did it the usual way with a scoop. So I suppose it depends on personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use, highest recommendation
customer_reviews.text: I've recommended these boxes to everyone I know that owns cats. I've bought the super expensive, hundred dollar automatic litter boxes before and they'd either break, or were messy, or you still had to do a lot of work. With this product, you don't have to touch anything but a handle, there's no leaks or cracks where litter falls out and the cats don't kick out as much litter as they used to because of the shape. I have four of these boxes and they all perform flawlessly, and it takes literal seconds to empty all of them. The set up is extremely easy as is the use. They're really large and litter doesn't stick to the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda D.

customer_reviews.title: Just make sure you have a good clumping litter
customer_reviews.text: I have used these boxes for years. No more scooping poop or pee out of a litter box. You just roll these over and the lumps go into a tray that you pull out and empty. Sometimes too much clean litter will get in the drawer but you can replace the litter and roll the box again. Just make sure you have a good clumping litter. Clump and Seal is my favorite. Clump and Seal and this box go together well. Plus they have upgraded this box with new side locks. Now I really love this box.
customer_reviews.author: VIVIAN CARR

customer_reviews.title: Not thrlled
customer_reviews.text: Cats, which I have three, do use it. Even my crippled on that I thought would have trouble getting in snd out.1) It is not yhst easy to tip. You don' have top just tip it on its side, you have to tip it all the way over on its top, not side. The latchs on the sides do not prevent litter from escaping. Real mess firt time. No I just clean it out as if it was any other hooded kitty litter pan.
customer_reviews.author: mary moger-bordeaux

customer_reviews.title: Mine was a faulty product
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't put it together for a long time because my house was in renovation. Now it is too late to return it, and I tried to contact the company, and they haven't responded. When I roll the canister, litter comes out the side. If I wanted litter all over the floor, I would just used a regular litter box and let the cats go wild. As it is, they see the little pile on the side and use that to pee on. It's absolutely useless. A very expensive mistake on my part. I have used these in the past and have been happy. I wish they would just replace this faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: Serene Gagniuk

customer_reviews.title: Sounds concept, but cheap product
customer_reviews.text: Sounds concept, but cheap product !! This last a just past 2 months. WE have one cat and clean the litter at least twice a day, and it is at the point i can not repair it anymore. Hope your luck is better than mine if you decide to buy.. Cons: * Breaks easily. (invested more in epoxy than the product. Plus sanding do the clumps don't get hung,bad as it is) * Grate, requires removal and scrubbing, to remove build up. (Not easy or convenient) * locking claps are not secure causing liter to spill win rocked (making bigger mess) * this goes on but its just chaps my ass! Pros: Concept
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: GOOD DESIGN WORKS AS DESCRIBED - FIXED THE ONLY MAJOR FLAW
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of cats so I very much like the convenience and speed of cleaning that this litter box design offers. It is well made/sturdy and works as described. However, my only complaint [reason for 4 stars & not 5] is the lack of latches on the right side of the box that allows litter to spill out when you roll the box! I remedied the problem by taking the advice of a previous reviewer and put large [2"] binder clips on that side to keep the lid tight.
customer_reviews.author: Donna OBrien

customer_reviews.title: Gimmick
customer_reviews.text: Sure the idea off not having to scoop your kitty litter sounds amazing, but this is not the solution you're looking for. There is a grate inside of the litter box that is supposed to act as a filter to separate the soiled littler from the clean. The grate isn't fine enough so things that shouldn't slip through do. Plus, it's just awkward rotating your litter box around. Gave it two stars because the base does at least act as a solid basin for cat littler so I suppose it meets that minimum requirement for a litter box.
customer_reviews.author: RYTIEPSONFSDFOINW

customer_reviews.title: 3 months... And it's trash.
customer_reviews.text: I should have been weary of all of the positive reviews knowing that this is yet another piece of plastic that's manufactured in China. After only 3 short months, the poorly molded divider that separates the waste from the litter has split causing the divider to constantly fall out of place which means it no longer functions at all. So like all plastic things from China, this major disappointment is going to the dump after very limited use and we're out the money. Very poor design.... What a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!! With only one flaw(cheap plastic)
customer_reviews.text: Here's a video review with voice over for those that want to see it work. I am not a fake person. I bought this litter box because I HATE cleaning up litter with a scoop, and toilet training was not working for my 9 year old cat. Watch for yourself and make your own decision. This box in the video is the LARGE, perfect size for my 6lb and 9lb cats. Remember when ordering that about 1/3 of the base is reserved for the litter cleaning, so if you have multiple or large cats, go with the large. For petite cats or cats that don't mind smaller spaces, the reg should be fine. Thanks for looking.
customer_reviews.author: Saranee

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE LOVE LOVE this litter box
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE LOVE LOVE this litter box!! The BEST we've ever had. My husband did end up bolting the grid inside to the bottom, since too much litter was seeping thru into the other side & then the grid wouldn't re-snap. It's SOOO easy to just roll, dump the turds out of the drawer, roll back over to re-level the litter! It's GREAT doing away with the bags, and keeps the litter dust down, much better for my asthma!! I do add litter box deodorizer or baking soda each time I dump though. I highly recommend this box!! Will last MUCH than the electric ones, that have mechanism to break!
customer_reviews.author: cookie1123

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Please,please heed other negative reviews. Cheaply made, closure tabs DO NOT WORK. Stuff still sticks to walls, so you have to take it apart to scrape off anyway, which defeats its whole purpose. Tried binder clips to hold together per suggestions, still didn't work. Thoroughly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: grandma367

customer_reviews.title: Works So-So.
customer_reviews.text: Very large, could easily fit both of my little 8 pound girls at once. Design is interesting. Snaps don't quite snap without some forcing, which has led to daily sweeping over large amounts of litter after turning the box over, even after repositioning. I'm not sure about everyone else's cats, but mine always seem to urinate in one spot and it clumps. These spots typically tend to stick, so even after turning the box over, they're still there. Any type of #2 that is not solid tends to get trapped in the grates. Overall, concept is good, but doesn't lessen the time or effort in cleaning, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Cheyenne

customer_reviews.title: The box is great but word to the wise
customer_reviews.text: The box is great but word to the wise: You MUST use clumping litter. Otherwise the soiled litter will just fall into the bottom compartment. Some litters, even the clumping kind, still stick to the sides and I have to knock chunks loose when tumbling it. I don't know that that's a design flaw of the box or the litter or just the nature of the beat. Either way, it still 100% beats scooping!
customer_reviews.author: K. Hydinger

customer_reviews.title: Haven't had leaking of litter like other viewers have stated
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had leaking of litter like other viewers have stated. One needs to flip to empty at least twice a day otherwise it sticks to bottom and does not go into pan. I have had it 2 weeks but it's at the point I need to take apart and throughly clean. So can't comment on that process. Cats tend to go straight in and do their business near opening. Litter is still scattered from their paws. Cats adjusted well, there was cat urine/poo several hours after I put down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great litter box!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this litter box several months ago. My ONLY complaint is that a small amount of litter does leak out when you roll it over for cleaning. In my case, it's a very small amount and I just vacuum it up after it leaks. So I'm taking one star off for making me vacuum occasionally!! Otherwise i absolutley love this litter box. It's so fast and convenient to clean it out!
customer_reviews.author: kattc

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Extremely easy to use. Very convenient. I've used it for about 3 weeks and I love it. The reason for the 4 stars is because I originally ordered the smaller version and the shipping date was one week after it had said it would be after I bought it. So I had to cancel and order the larger version. I like the larger version better, any way. My kitten is small but she'll grow into it. It also didn't come with instructions on how to put it together.. I had to lol it up. But advice for those who do use it, make sure the tray is in the box fully before rolling!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Idea and everything about this was nice, however there are major flaws
customer_reviews.text: Idea and everything about this was nice, however there are major flaws. Sometimes the thing would leak from the bottom, sotime if the shifter got wet litter woudl stick and then nothing got shifted. Personal issue was my cat pee's in gaint clumps so the hold was to small to pull it out so it would smear on top of the box. Something the latches wouldn't close without force. This is a good product if you have ONE tiny cat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easiest way to clean a litter box
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. A few minor complaints. You roll the box to clean, I often have to bang on the bottom to loosen everything up. Then you roll back upright and remove tray. Complaints are that the tray doesn't fit all the way in, so some litter does get on the floor when rolling. To add litter or to clean, you need to unsnap to remove the lid. Snapping it back on is a little tricky. Love this box though! Would recommend to anyone and everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Krista R. Hanner

customer_reviews.title: Not such a great idea
customer_reviews.text: I stopped using it the way it was designed. It has a grate inside that's suppose to capture the litter and everything else rolls up into the tray. I found that the litter would clump in this grate and sometimes the feces. Smaller stuff would go through the grate so I found manually cleaning works best. The other issue is the size when adding the grate significantly shrinks the amount of space for the cat to use. I removed the grate and the tray that everything is suppose to dump into.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Changed My Life!!
customer_reviews.text: Changed my life!! How many of you love your kitties but hate the idea of the litter box? I hear ya! I have spent bunches on the electronic auto litter boxes and they worked a while but cost so much to replace and aren't the best. This litter box isn't automatic, but sure does make life much easier than having to deal with the scooper. A bonus is that it is covered so you don't have to see the contents all the time. I highly recommended this litter box!
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but.....
customer_reviews.text: DId not work. The tray that collected the used litter was concave. That meant that each time I rolled the device to move the litter to the tray, much of it ended up not in the tray. Cheaply made and hard to put together. Eventually gave it away
customer_reviews.author: MLBNFP

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: I found that the grate inside takes up half the room inside which leaves a small amount a room for our day to do it business. My cat didn’t like using it and began using the floor outside instead. The whole design doesn’t really help in keeping it cleaned out. The smell is still pretty bad. I’m going back to the $10 pan at Walmart and I’m going to chuck this thing out.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: A Bit Messy but WORTH IT
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so worth it. It's a little small, and spills litter a bit, but man it makes cleaning the little box a super simple 2 minute task! Wish they had a bigger one or at least one with a tighter lid. Litter ends up seeping out of the side when you turn it over. My girlfriend did have problems with it, but I don't think she latched the top on properly. 4 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Phanichkul

customer_reviews.title: ... the edge to hold the clips shut is a good idea. I decided to try adding litter using ...
customer_reviews.text: Putting tape around the edge to hold the clips shut is a good idea. I decided to try adding litter using the waste collection scoop and it really works great. After emptying the waste just put litter in the scoop and dump it through the door. It's shape is perfect for adding more litter. The point is once this is assembled tape the latches and don't open it unless you have to. The whole thing is held together by the top lid. Also buy the Litter Genie it's totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: George Burkard

customer_reviews.title: Too small and inconvinient
customer_reviews.text: It's not worth it. The top has only a few locks so when you turn it to clean it all the litter comes out of the sides. The filter inside moves a lot I had to tape it so it wouldn't be a mess. The pre sticks to the bottom of the box so it's pretty much pointless to have this because you have to open it to clean it. I'm so u happy with this purchase. It is also not big a all, the filter takes up half of the box inside so my Main Coon 20 lbs doesn't not fit. He digs with half his body inside then goes in. It's sad my poor baby.
customer_reviews.author: marifer

customer_reviews.title: Researched a lot of these online and this seemed like it had the best reviews
customer_reviews.text: Researched a lot of these online and this seemed like it had the best reviews, so I gave it as a Christmas gift to a a very skeptical son...and he says it works GREAT for his two large cats!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jane Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Best cat pan ever!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this litter box. I have 4 cats and hate scooping. My only other choice have been regular litter which I find gross. I saw this had mixed reviews, but for the price thought it was worth a try....and it was. Super simple, super clean and super convenient. It is a bit large and bulky but that is a small flaw easily out weighed by the benefits. I only ordered one to try but am going to order more.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Husband calls this life-changing...
customer_reviews.text: We just recently purchased this and my husband calls it life-changing. He has been the sole litter box cleaner ever since I was pregnant 5 years ago and over the last 9 years we have been through many different litter boxes so I like to think he knows what he is talking about. Without spending a fortune on an automated litter box this easily cleans it with just a little manpower. You just have to roll it until its almost at the top, roll it back to get the litter flat and then pull out the tray with all the dirty litter. So far it has worked like a charm for us(I mean my husband)!
customer_reviews.author: Al D.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend getting the larger one as the smaller one is ...
customer_reviews.text: The easiest solution for your litterbox needs. Go from scooping your litterbox for 5 minutes to just a quick flip that lasts maybe 20 seconds. I have five cats and I want to throw away all other litterboxes and get 4 more of these. I would recommend getting the larger one as the smaller one is almost ridiculously small. My cats won't use it because of how small it is. The larger one has enough room for two cats to be in there at the same time (depending on the size of your cat).
customer_reviews.author: Dwrizzle

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, breaks in a few days
customer_reviews.text: This product used to be great. I have 2 I bought several years ago that still work great. Then the company must have decided they could make more money using cheap material. I had the one I just bought replaced and the same thing happened as the first. The flap on the grating piece snaps right off. Poor quality. Great product if it wasn't so poorly manufactured.
customer_reviews.author: K. Juday

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy clean up with two cats
customer_reviews.text: I have two kittens and the regular litter box was filling up twice daily, or more. This box is larger, and emptying the box is quit and easy. It's not self cleaning like the motorized ones, but the whole process is really simple and quit. I discovered that the type of litter is critical. Less well clumping litter was sticking to the floor and gross. Also started spraying the bottom and grill with cooking spray when I do a full empty and clean about every two weeks and now have nothing sticking and no odor. I use the biodegradable, odor preventive bags that I have for dog walks to dispose of the clumps and it's fine in the regular trash.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Jean

customer_reviews.title: I have 5 cats an am so pleased with this I bought another
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 cats an am so pleased with this I bought another! Everyone I show it to is amazed and immediately want to know where I got it. When I tell them the price they rush to order one for themselves... Great product! This works great with a litter genie for quick and easy litter box cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Bishop

product_meta.title: Omega Paw Self-Cleaning Litter Box, Pewter
product_meta.description:
The Roll Away Self Cleaning Litter Box cleans in just seconds without scooping. Inside the litter box there is a unique patented grill that separates out the clumped waste, depositing it into the pullout tray. The Large Litter Box is great for big cats or for multiple cat households. No electricity or expensive filters needed!

AMAZON.COM



SAVE MONEY!

DO YOU HATE CLEANING YOUR LITTER BOX BUT CAN'T AFFORD ONE OF THOSE EXPENSIVE MOTORIZED MODELS? 

Omega Paw's Roll'n Clean, Self-Cleaning Litter Box is just what you are looking for! The Roll'n Clean litter box doesn't use electricity, never breaks down; it just keeps rolling and rolling. Save yourself the headaches and money by buying this amazing self-cleaning litter box.

Ideal for big cats or multiple-cat households, this large Roll’n Clean, Self-Cleaning Litter Box quickly self-cleans, while controlling dust and containing odors. Omega Paw’s Roll’n Clean, Self-Cleaning Litter Box allows you to clean your cat’s waste in just seconds, without scooping! Also requires less litter than a traditional litter box and the scoop only collects clumped waste - clean litter is never thrown away.




HOW IT WORKS
The Roll’n Clean, Self-Cleaning Litter Box works best with clumping and silica litters. Simply roll the litter box to the right until the top touches the floor then roll it back to the upright position. Inside, a unique patented screen separates the clean litter from the clumped waste – putting all the waste into the scoop. Pull out the scoop and dispose the waste. It’s that easy!



PRODUCT FEATURES
 * Self-cleans by rolling to the right and back again 
 * Waste collects in the pullout scoop for quick and easy disposal 
 * No electricity or filters needed
 * Controls dust and contains odors
 * Ideal for big cats or multiple-cat households
 * Ships in Certified Frustration-Free Packaging 
 * One year warranty
